thread.title: Your first trade for Wednesday, March 28

title: Your first trade for Wednesday, March 28
text:
The " Fast Money " traders shared their first moves for the market open.
Tim Seymour was a buyer of General Motors .
David Seaburg was a buyer of Alphabet .
Brian Kelly was a buyer of SPDR Gold Shares .
Guy Adami was a buyer of Red Hat .
Trader disclosure: On March 27, 2018, the following stocks and commodities mentioned or intended to be mentioned on CNBC's "Fast Money" were owned by the "Fast Money" traders: Tim Seymour is long AMZA, APC, BABA, BAC, BX, C, CCJ, CLF, CMG, CSCO, CX, DAL, DPZ, DVYE, EEM, ERJ, EUFN, EWM, FB, FXI, GE, GILD, GM, GOOGL, HAL, INTC, JD, MAT, MCD, MO, MOS, MPEL, PAK, PHM, PYPL, RAI, RH, RL, SBUX, SQ, T, TIF, TWTR, UA, UAL, VALE, VIAB, VIPS, VOD, VRX, X, XLE, XRT, YNDX, 700.HK. Tim is short IWM, RACE, SPY. "Opinions expressed by David Seaburg are solely his own and do not reflect the views and opinions of Cowen Inc. David Seaburg has a financial interest in EDIT. Diamond Offshore: an employee of Cowen Inc. serves on the Board of Directors of Diamond Offshore." Brian Kelly is long Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin. Guy Adami is long CELG, EXAS, GDX, INTC. Guy Adami's wife, Linda Snow, works at Merck.
